column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Then there was silence for a time
#Text=While Hubert had been in the “ Trap , ” his father and uncle had been walking along the beach , and the former heard for the first time the nature and danger of the “ Smuggler 's Trap . ”

#Text=He was at once filled with anxiety about his son , and had hurried to the place to call him back , when to his horror he found that the tide had already covered the only way by which the dangerous place might be approached .
#Text=No sooner had he heard Hubert 's answering cry than he rushed forward to try and save him .
#Text=But the next moment a great wave came rolling in and dashed him upon the cliff .
#Text=Terribly bruised , he clung to the cliff till the surf fell back , and then ran on again .
#Text=He slipped over a rock and fell , but instantly regaining his feet he advanced further , and in his haste fell into a hollow which was filled with water .
#Text=Before he could emerge another wave was upon him .
#Text=This one beat him down , and it was only by clinging to the seaweed that he escaped being sucked back by the retreating surge .
#Text=Bold and frenzied though he was , he had to start back from the fury of such an assault as this .
#Text=He rushed backward and waited .
#Text=His eyes searched wildly around .
#Text=He noticed that the surf grew more violent every moment , and every moment took away hope .
#Text=But he would not yield .
#Text=Once more he rushed forward .
#Text=The waves rolled in , but he grasped the rocks and withstood the surf , and still advanced .
#Text=Another followed .
#Text=He bowed before it , and clinging to the rocks as before came forth triumphant .
#Text=Already he was nearly halfway .
#Text=He sprang upon a rock that rose above the level of the seething flood , and stood for a moment panting and gasping .
#Text=But now a great wave came rolling in upon him .
#Text=He fell on his knees and clung to the seaweed .
#Text=The wave struck .
#Text=It hurled him from the rock .
#Text=He rolled over and over .
#Text=Blinded , bruised and half drowned , he felt himself dashed against the cliff .
#Text=He threw his arms wildly about , but found nothing which he could seize .
#Text=The retreating wave sucked him back .
#Text=But a rock stayed him .
#Text=This he grasped and was saved .
#Text=Then , hastily scrambling to his feet , he staggered back to the place from which he had started .
#Text=Before he could get back another wave threw him down , and this time he might have been drowned had not his brother plunged in and dragged him out .
#Text=Of all this Hubert had seen nothing , and known nothing .
#Text=He waited for some time in silence , and then called .
#Text=There was no answer .
#Text=He called again and again .
#Text=But at that time his father was struggling with the waves and did not hear him .
#Text=At last , after what seemed an interminable time , he heard once more his father 's voice .
#Text=He shouted back .
#Text=“ Do n't be afraid ! ” cried the voice .
#Text=“ I 'll get you out .
#Text=Wait . ”
#Text=And then there were no more voices .
#Text=It was about two o'clock when Hubert had entered the gorge .
#Text=It was after three when his father had roused him , and made his vain effort to save him .
#Text=Hubert was now left alone with the rising tide , whose waters rolled forward with fearful rapidity .
#Text=The beach inside was nearly level and he saw that in an hour or so it would be covered with the waters .

#Text=He tried to trust to his father 's promise , but the precious moments passed and he began to look with terror upon the increasing storm ; for every moment the wind grew fiercer , and the surf rolled in with ever increasing impetuosity .
#Text=He looked all around for a place of refuge , and saw nothing except the rock which arose at the extremity of the place , at the foot of the overhanging cliffs .
#Text=It was about five feet high , and was the only place that afforded anything like safety .
#Text=Up this he clambered , and from this he could survey the scene , but only to perceive the full extent of his danger .

#Text=For the tide rushed in more and more swiftly , the surf grew higher and higher and he saw plainly that before long the water would reach the summit of the rock , and that even before then the surf in its violence would sweep him away .
#Text=The moments passed slowly .
#Text=Minutes seemed in his suspense to be transformed to hours .
#Text=The sky was overspread now with black clouds ; and the gloom increased .
#Text=At length the waves rolled in until they covered all the beach in front , and began to dash against the rock on which he had taken refuge .
#Text=The precious moments passed .
#Text=Higher and higher grew the waters .
#Text=They came rolling into the cave , urged on by the fury of the billows outside , and heaping themselves up as they were compressed into this narrow gorge .
#Text=They dashed up around the rock .
#Text=The spray was tossed in his face .
#Text=Already he felt their inexorable grasp .
#Text=Death seemed so near that hope left him .
#Text=He fell upon his knees with his hands clasped , and his white face upturned .
#Text=Just then a great wave rolled up and flung itself over the rock , and over his knees as he knelt , and over his hands as he clasped them in prayer .
#Text=A few more moments and all would be over .
